page.title: 13END OF TERM-PRINCES RISBOR;
page.content: The Leaver's ceremony represents the last gathering of the 5th yeart pupils at the secondary school. Over the years it has become a tradition of the school and is much looked forward to by the pupils, who spend much time (and money) on their appearance. Parents and friends gather in the school hall at about 9.30 and have a short school type assembly. Afterwards certificates are presented by a school governor to show that the pupils have completed their course at the school, when this is finished parents, friends and pupils are invited to have refreshements in a Very friendly, social atmosphere. To keep a record of this event pupils and parents take photographs of their friends and sign the envelopes in which they keep their certificates.
